Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US — a land where anyone from the upper population levels can succeed — for the most part judges wealth as somehow being equal to or symbiosis with inherent goodness and intellect. The Dutch, from what I can tell being an outsider looking in, are a culture where wealth is privileged first of all over intellect. A very top-down

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Universal’s Gothic aesthetic. Allen is also capable of some great moments of suspense and he presents the complicated moral question of whether the world is to be conquered or left alone to evolve on its own balance sheet. However, the pacing is all over the place and he really underestimates his characters.
